poem:
"Triumph of the Bull Market"

In the ever-drowsy morning light,
The UK economy takes flight.
Like a bird escaping winter's bite,
FTSE lifts to a new height.

But the shadows of interest rates,
Like heavy, unseen weights,
May constrain the pace, anticipates
Muir of Moody's estate.

Still, with each cut and inflation taper,
Economy crafts a new skyscraper,
Under the dawn's newspaper, a financial caper.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "UK economy escapes recession with fastest growth since 2021, sending FTSE 100 to new high – business live 9.55am BST Moody’s Analytics: interest rates will constrain growth this year High interest rates are likely to weigh on growth this year, even if we do get the two quarter-point cuts which markets expect. Moody’s Analytics senior economist David Muir explains: “With inflation moderating, the Bank of England is signalling that a rate cut is on the". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
